intro: Adonanthe mongolica, commonly known as the Mongolian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are typically lance-shaped. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, semi-desert environments. Adonanthe mongolica is often found growing in rocky or sandy habitats, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its native range.
